Paul Atreides.Action: Studies filmbooks and maps of Arrakis and the Universe carefully, showing dedication to learning about his future environment.
Whispers observations about Arrakis, indicating thoughtful and attentive behavior.
Acknowledges Thufir and others entering quietly, shows awareness and calmness.
Admits to not being in the mood for shield practice, apologizes to Gurney.
Engages in a tense knife fight with Gurney after a sharp exchange.
Recognizes the enemy's homeworld and identifies the Baron Harkonnen as the enemy.
Acknowledges sitting with his back to the door but confidently claims he can distinguish real footsteps from imitations.
Engages in shield practice with Gurney despite initially expressing he is 'not in the mood', then quickly recovers and prepares for the fight.
Admits to being 'not in the mood' for training, showing a momentary lapse in mental readiness.
Engages seriously and respectfully in a sparring fight with Gurney, showing focus and restraint.
Questions Gurney about whether he would have drawn blood, showing concern and openness.
Acknowledges the seriousness of their situation with a calm demeanor.
Responds quickly and skillfully in a close combat fight with Gurney, managing to pin him with a blade at the neck.
Recognizes the seriousness of the situation and the need to move beyond play fighting, showing situational awareness and maturity.
Questions Gurney about whether he would have drawn blood, showing a reflective and cautious mindset.
Falls back initially in the fight and is surprised by Gurney's serious attack, indicating a momentary lapse in anticipating Gurney's intent.
Smiles when discussing the Fremen's blue-within-blue eyes and the spice effect.
Bows respectfully to Thufir after being called a formidable Duke.
Questions the purpose of going into a potential trap, showing cautiousness and engagement.
Asks insightful questions about the dangers of Arrakis, such as the size of the worms, the speed of the sandstorms, and how the Fremen survive.
Connects the blue-within-blue eyes of the Fremen to spice saturation, showing knowledge and curiosity about the environment and its effects.
Recognizes the political danger behind the Harkonnens, suspecting the Emperor's involvement.
Questions the wisdom of proceeding if the mission might be a trap, showing critical thinking and caution.
Bows to Thufir upon being called a formidable Duke, showing respect and confidence.
Greets Duncan Idaho happily and expresses wish that Duncan would come with them.
Responds sincerely to Duncan's farewell with a shared blessing.
Reflects thoughtfully on the bull's head as a possible evil omen, showing sensitivity.
Uses the weirding module to emit a powerful sound and rush towards the robot fighter, demonstrating skill and control in a complex training exercise.
Observes the bull's head with dried blood and questions if it is an evil omen, showing awareness and reflection but some uncertainty.
Greets Duncan Idaho warmly and expresses a wish for his company, showing social confidence and emotional intelligence.
Smiles up at his father after expressing desire to make him proud.
Whispers in troubled sleep about Arrakis, showing internal struggle but no outward expression of distress to others.
Acknowledges praise from his father and mentors, expressing a desire to make them proud.
Observes and contemplates the Atreides banner and the environment, showing awareness and reflection.
Sweats and whispers in his sleep, struggling with disturbing thoughts about Arrakis.
Pretends to be asleep when Jessica and the Reverend Mother enter, avoiding confrontation.
Pretends to be asleep when hearing footsteps outside his door, showing awareness and control of the situation.
Whispers about Arrakis and desert planet in fitful sleep, indicating internal processing and focus on important matters.
No direct action or response to the Reverend Mother's harsh words and accusations, potentially showing restraint or composure.
Sits up attentively when called by his mother, showing responsiveness and respect.
Internal questioning about 'Kwisatz Haderach' and his father's expectations, indicating introspection but no outward emotional expression.
Sits up in bed alertly after hearing important information, showing awareness and readiness.
Questions the significance of being the Kwisatz Haderach for his father, indicating critical thinking and reflection.
Questions the Reverend Mother about his father, showing concern.
Fights against the Reverend Mother's control using The Voice, asserting his own will.
Complies with the Reverend Mother's demand to put his hand in the pain box despite fear.
Recognizes the use of The Voice and consciously resists its control.
Questions the Reverend Mother about his father, showing awareness and concern.
Despite fear and pain, obeys the Reverend Mother's command to put his hand in the box, showing self-control and discipline.
Faces extreme pain silently and composes himself using inner discipline ('I must not fear. Fear is the mind-killer.')
Endures extreme pain from the gom jabbar test without withdrawing his hand despite intense burning and mental images of destruction.
Mentally recites 'I must not fear. Fear is the mind-killer.' to control his fear and maintain composure during the test.
Momentarily reacts with an involuntary outburst 'THE PAIN!' showing a brief loss of emotional control.
Complies with the Reverend Mother's test without complaint, showing respect and trust.
Acknowledges the truthfulness of the Reverend Mother's statements sincerely.
Responds calmly and openly to the Reverend Mother's probing questions about his dreams.
Pulls his hand out of the pain-inducing box without injury and recognizes the nature of the test, showing calmness and understanding.
States that he knows when people speak the truth, indicating confidence and perceptiveness.
Demonstrates awareness of his dreams and which ones will come true, showing insight and self-knowledge.
Asks questions about the Kwisatz Haderach and the Water of Life, showing curiosity and willingness to learn.
Expresses urgent concern for his father's life, refuses to accept the possibility of his death, demands reassurance from the Reverend Mother.
Questions the Reverend Mother about the fate of those who tried to become the Kwisatz Haderach, showing curiosity and awareness of danger.
Insists on focusing on his father's survival despite warnings, demonstrating emotional intensity but possibly clouded judgment.
Refuses to accept the Reverend Mother's implication that his father might be dead, showing determination and confidence.
Interrupts and challenges authority figures (Reverend Mother, Jessica) in a tense moment, which could be seen as impulsive or lacking strategic patience.
Observes the ship stopping and folding space with calm and thoughtful inner voice.
Wanders alone through darkened passageways, showing introspection and solitude.
Wanders alone through darkened passageways, showing calmness and confidence in a tense environment.
Takes time to carefully check pastries for poison before eating.
Feels uneasiness and fear alone in the palace, showing vulnerability.
Mentally questions the terrible purpose behind the spice, showing concern and thoughtfulness.
Recognizes and acknowledges the presence of a traitor among his people promptly and communicates this to Jessica.
Present in strategic military meeting with Duke Leto, Thufir, and generals, indicating involvement in high-level planning and security measures.

Smiles and shakes head with Duke Leto, indicating calm composure and mutual understanding in tense situation.
Does not leave the palace despite the suggestion to inspect spice mining operations, showing prudence and caution.
Is found dead on a stone floor, indicating a failure or vulnerability at this moment.
No direct action or statement by Paul in this excerpt; focus is on Jessica and Mapes interaction.
Politely inquires if Kynes is a Fremen, showing interest and respect.
Mentally notes that Kynes is hiding something, indicating suspicion and guardedness.
Expresses gratitude by calling the stillsuit a 'blessing of the river,' showing appreciation and sincerity.
Questions Dr. Kynes directly about his identity and allegiance, showing awareness and curiosity.
Internally senses that Dr. Kynes is hiding something, demonstrating perceptiveness and intuition.
Uses a phrase 'Your gift is a blessing of the river' that agitates the Fremen guards, indicating knowledge of cultural or symbolic language.
Responds politely and sincerely to Kynes' inspection and questions about the stillsuit, showing openness and respect.
Does not assert superiority or dismiss Kynes despite being a noble, instead shows humility by admitting he learned the suit fitting intuitively.
Wears a stillsuit fitted in proper desert fashion without prior instruction, demonstrating intuitive understanding of complex survival gear.
Asks Kynes questions about the worms and spice, showing curiosity and engagement.
Internally notes 'I've registered him now' about Kynes, indicating careful observation but no overt friendliness.
Asks insightful questions about the sandworms and spice mining, showing curiosity and a desire to understand his environment.
Internally notes and registers information from Dr. Kynes, indicating active listening and mental processing.
Suddenly asks a question aloud about the relationship between the worms and the spice, showing curiosity and engagement.
Internally notes that Kynes is hiding many things and that he is a person born to command, showing perceptiveness but also a reserved, somewhat distant attitude.
Turns to Gurney worriedly when Duke Leto confronts the radio voices, showing concern for others' safety.
Turns to Gurney with a worried expression when the carryall is not responding and the worm is approaching.
Feels the fear of the men around him during the harvester attack.
Remains calm and observant during a chaotic and dangerous situation involving the harvester and approaching threat.
Feels the fear of others but does not panic, indicating emotional control and situational awareness.
No direct action or command given in this excerpt, but presence and awareness suggest readiness and understanding.
Listens attentively to Kynes and shows curiosity about the spice and Liet Kynes.
Focuses on the events unfolding around the harvester attack without showing panic or selfish concern.
Recognizes the significance of the spice and the name 'Liet' quickly, showing alertness and ability to connect information.
Observes the harvester's destruction calmly and attentively, indicating situational awareness.
Struggles painfully to call out to his father when drugged, showing concern and vulnerability.
Strains with all his might to lift himself and call out to his father despite being drugged and in a fitful sleep.
Is the motivation behind Yueh's betrayal and sabotage, as Yueh hopes to save Paul and Jessica's lives.
Is the intended beneficiary of Dr. Yueh's plan to save his life and enable a future attack on the Baron, indicating others' trust in his capability and importance.
No direct action or decision by Paul in this excerpt; he is absent from the immediate scene and thus shows no competence or incompetence here.
Struggles to use The Voice to protect his mother from harm.
Attempts to use the Voice to command the guards to not harm his mother despite being bound and in a dangerous situation.
Uses The Voice to command guards to remove Jessica's gag, protecting her from assault.
Remains calm and uses long, calming breaths after being hit, showing self-control.
Kills a guard violently to save himself and his mother.
Uses The Voice to command the guards to remove Jessica's gag, demonstrating control and presence of mind under pressure.
Recovers quickly after being hit with a stungun and uses calming breaths to maintain composure.
Kicks upwards with extreme power to kill the guard, showing physical skill and decisiveness.
Pulls desperately on the controls and manages to keep the ship aloft and flying into the deep desert despite imminent crash.
Pulls desperately on the controls and manages to keep the ship aloft and flying into the deep desert despite the damage and imminent crash.
Acknowledges his father's death calmly and admits to feeling no emotions, showing internal struggle.
Urgently instructs Jessica to hurry and be cautious of the sandworm, showing concern for their safety.
Silently clutches his father's ring, indicating a private moment of respect and connection.

Remains calm and assesses the situation while struggling to control the failing `thopter, identifies a possible safe landing spot in the forbidden South Polar region, and directs Jessica to prepare for landing and potential danger.
Feels no emotions upon learning of his father's death, indicating possible emotional detachment or shock, which could impair immediate decision-making.
Feels disconnected from his emotions and unable to feel for others, even his mother who is crying.
Pulls Jessica to shelter during their escape, providing physical protection and support.
Pulls Jessica to shelter in the desert, showing quick protective instincts and situational awareness.
Internally questions his own feelings and emotional state, indicating self-awareness but also emotional uncertainty.
Focuses on symbolic and prophetic imagery (mouse moon, dreams) to interpret his situation, demonstrating thoughtful reflection and strategic thinking.
Shares his waking dream and fears openly with his mother, showing vulnerability and trust.
Acknowledges the changes in himself due to the spice and credits his mother's teachings, indicating respect and sincerity.
Declares he is not the Kwisatz Haderach but something different, asserting his identity strongly.
Vows to continue killing to avenge his father's death, showing a hardened, ruthless resolve.
Recognizes the pervasive influence of the spice and its effects on his consciousness, showing insight and self-awareness.
Declares himself as something different and unexpected, indicating confidence and a strong sense of identity.
Acknowledges his role as a killer and commits to avenging his father's death, demonstrating resolve and determination.
Finds a paper with Dr. Yueh's mark on it while looking through a Fremkit, indicating careful observation and use of resources.
Warns his mother about the dangers ahead and plans a strategy to divert the worm using a thumper.
Instructs Jessica on how to avoid attracting the worm and ensures she is prepared.
Recognizes the danger of the situation and quickly decides to head for the mountain of rock as a safer location.
Plants a thumper to divert the sandworm, demonstrating knowledge of desert survival tactics and foresight.
Instructs Jessica to walk without rhythm to avoid attracting the worm, showing clear understanding and leadership.
Moves confidently and calmly in a dangerous environment, maintaining focus despite physical strain.
Drags Jessica up after she falls while escaping the worm.
Commands Jessica to run and urges faster movement to escape danger.
Commands to move faster and urges Jessica to run despite exhaustion and danger.
Recognizes the change in terrain to 'drum sand' and uses this knowledge to navigate more safely.
Stops to help Jessica when she falls, showing situational awareness and care under pressure.
Leads the climb up the narrow rock slit to escape the worm, demonstrating quick thinking and use of environment.
Crouches with Jessica in the tiny passageway of safety, sharing the danger together.
Focuses on survival and observation of the worm and spice, no direct interaction or expression of concern for others beyond Jessica.
Warns Jessica about the presence of others and cautiously explores the crevice with her.
Shares discovery of man-carved steps and proceeds carefully with Jessica.

Leads Jessica cautiously through a dark crevice and notices man-carved steps, showing observation skills and careful navigation.
Responds calmly and quietly in a dangerous situation when confronted by Fremen, demonstrating composure and confidence.
Accepts Stilgar's bond and sanctuary offer, showing respect to Fremen culture and leaders.
Stares at Chani in wonder and listens to her, showing openness and sincere interest.
Moves quickly to support Jessica during confrontation, demonstrating loyalty and protective instincts.
Moves quickly and skillfully to gain a tactical advantage by climbing a rocky incline and positioning himself between rocks to observe the Fremen troop.
Responds promptly to Jessica's defensive action and the tense situation, showing situational awareness and confidence.
Pauses and notices Chani, showing curiosity and recognition from his dreams, indicating perceptiveness and thoughtful reflection.
Accepts the Fremen's secret name and is welcomed by them, showing openness and respect for their culture.
Reaches out and touches Chani's hand and cheek in a moment of emotional connection.
Accepts the Fremen secret name Usul and chooses the public name Muad'dib, showing understanding of cultural significance and integration.
Asks about the meaning of the mouse shadow on the second moon, demonstrating curiosity and desire to learn.
Is emotionally moved and unable to speak when Chani asks about his homeworld, showing vulnerability but also deep emotional connection.
Expresses wonder and reverence upon discovering the water reservoir, calling it a 'treasure' and sharing the moment with Stilgar and Jessica.
Shares a questioning look with Jessica, indicating openness and connection in an uncertain situation.
Recognizes the significance of the wind traps and moisture in the passageway, showing awareness of the environment and its strategic importance.
Identifies the underground reservoir of water as a treasure and recalls having seen it in a dream, demonstrating insight, foresight, and connection to his visions.
Shares a questioning look with Jessica when noticing the changing environment, indicating cautious observation and communication.
Addresses the Fremen crowd with humility, calling himself 'only a seed' and using the name Usul, showing respect for their culture.
Speaks sincerely about the shared enemy and the need to unite against the Harkonnens, emphasizing collective struggle and responsibility.
Proposes to train one hundred warriors who will then train thousands, showing trust and investment in the community's growth and strength.
Focuses on strategic destruction of spice production to force political change, showing pragmatic and possibly ruthless intent.
Teaches the Fremen a powerful new fighting technique with confidence and clarity, inspiring awe and respect.
Demonstrates the destructive power of the weirding way by shattering the obelisk, showing control and restraint by stopping others from using violence unnecessarily.
Focuses on training the Fremen to be fierce and feared fighters, emphasizing killing enemies until no Harkonnen remain on Arrakeen.
Demonstrates the power of the weirding way by shattering a rock obelisk with a sound amplified by his weirding module, impressing the Fremen.
Calmly instructs and motivates the Fremen, showing clear understanding and control of the new fighting technique.
Motions a Fremen with a lasgun to move back, showing situational awareness and control over the demonstration.
Internally vows to turn the Fremen into killing machines to avenge his father.
Looks at Chani and cannot stop looking at her, showing personal affection.
Internally commits to turning the Fremen into killing machines to avenge his father, showing resolve and strategic thinking.
Responds to Stilgar's invitation to witness the Water of Life ritual, indicating willingness to learn and engage with Fremen culture.

Reflects internally on the lethal nature of the Water of Life and the dangers faced by others, showing awareness and humility.
Does not intervene or express fear despite the horrifying scene of the baby worm's death, maintaining composure.
Recognizes the Water of Life as the most lethal poison in the universe and recalls the Reverend Mother's warning that many men have tried and died attempting the ritual.
Listens carefully and shows awareness of the dangers involved in the ritual, indicating thoughtful caution and preparation.
Expresses concern for his mother Jessica's safety during the dangerous rite by asking 'What if she should fail?'
Expresses concern about the potential failure of the ritual, showing awareness and caution.

Gives clear, direct commands to the Fremen during training.
Commands the Fremen to activate their weirding modules and sets the range precisely, demonstrating control and technical knowledge.
Successfully shoots off the robot's arm with a precise shot and confidently interacts with Korba, showing skill and leadership.
Pauses thoughtfully at the foot of the steps before giving commands, indicating measured and confident behavior.
Refers to his own name as a 'killing word' and wonders if it can be a 'healing word' as well.
Smiles as he watches the Fremen fighters charging into battle, expressing pride and admiration.
Mentions to Stilgar that the Fremen are better on the battlefield than in training, showing respect and encouragement.
Accepts Stilgar's invitation to become a sandrider and lead the Fremen, showing willingness to integrate and lead with them.
Accepts the responsibility to become a sandrider and lead the Fremen, showing readiness to take on a challenging leadership role.
Follows Stilgar's detailed instructions carefully on how to plant the hook and ride the sandworm, demonstrating attentiveness and willingness to learn complex skills.
Faces the terrifying giant sandworm with calm determination, showing courage and focus.
Runs alongside the worm and takes physical risks to plant the hook, demonstrating commitment and trustworthiness to his people.
Plants the hook on the giant sandworm and controls it despite the danger, narrowly escaping being sucked under.
Freezes momentarily as the enormous worm approaches, showing initial hesitation.
Yells 'Long live the fighters!' to rally companions during worm ride.
Climbs the giant sandworm skillfully, planting hooks and steering it confidently across the desert.
Leads the group with a traditional call and demonstrates control over the sandworm, showing leadership and mastery of desert skills.
Reunites warmly with Gurney Halleck, embraces him, and shows a sign of trust and recognition.
Kills a man threatening him without hesitation.
Moves confidently through a smoky battlefield, quickly reacts to an armed attacker by using his weirding module to kill him, showing quick reflexes and combat skill.
Recognizes and reassures Gurney Halleck, demonstrating presence of mind and leadership by calming a potentially tense situation.
Survives an assassination attempt and evades death, remaining alive in the deep desert with the Fremen despite the Emperor's and Guild's efforts to kill him.
Becomes a significant threat to the Emperor and the Spice production, indicating his effective leadership and influence among the Fremen.
Is not directly shown in this excerpt taking action or making statements, but the fact that others recognize his survival and threat implies his competence indirectly.
Shares a quiet, intimate moment with Chani, showing trust and connection.
Nods to the Fedaykin, indicating leadership and reliance on his followers.
Paul's eyes snap open at the sound of the approaching worm, showing alertness and readiness in a dangerous environment.

Urgently asks Chani to hurry, showing vulnerability and trust in her.
Takes the Water of Life despite the danger and unknown outcome.
Expresses fear and uncertainty ('Hurry! All I see is darkness.') before the trial.
Paul's mouth opens and a giant wind is stirred on the desert, his sound destroys the Guild Navigator and opens the Alam, enabling travel through rings of light and stars.
Paul lies motionless after the worm encounter but then slowly opens his eyes and sits up, showing recovery and awareness.
Paul slowly gets to his knees and stands, then loudly proclaims 'THE SLEEPER HAS AWAKENED,' signaling confidence and command.
Raises his open hand to silence the crowd and speaks solemnly to the Fremen, acknowledging their shared destiny and inspiring them with a unifying call.
Delivers a powerful, commanding speech invoking a storm and rallying the Fremen to war against the Emperor.
Commands silence and attention from a large group of Fremen warriors, demonstrating confident leadership.
Delivers a powerful and inspiring speech that unites and motivates the Fremen to prepare for war.
Raises his crysknife and leads the Fremen in a war chant, showing symbolic and practical leadership.
Orders Gurney to set off atomics to create an opening through the Shield Wall during the storm, showing strategic planning and decisive command.
Confirms wormsign with Stilgar before proceeding, demonstrating reliance on expert knowledge and situational awareness.
Smiles confidently upon hearing Stilgar's report of overwhelming wormsign, indicating confidence and morale leadership.
Smiles and laughs warmly with Gurney and Stilgar, showing lightheartedness and camaraderie.
Maintains composure and smiles confidently after Alia delivers a powerful message that unsettles the Emperor and others.
Laughs and makes a light comment to Gurney and Stilgar about Alia keeping pace with the storm, showing calmness and control in a tense situation.
Commands Gurney to initiate the atomic explosions to breach the Shield Wall, enabling the Fremen attack.
Commands Gurney to initiate the atomic explosions to breach the Shield Wall, demonstrating strategic planning and decisive leadership.
Leads the Fremen by riding the lead sandworm into battle during a violent storm, demonstrating control and command in a dangerous situation.
Successfully coordinates with Gurney and Stilgar while navigating the storm and the attack, showing teamwork and leadership.
Uses the sandworms effectively as a weapon against the Sardaukar, indicating strategic thinking and mastery of Fremen tactics.
Orders that Thufir Hawat, an old servant and captive, be set free despite the tense situation.
Offers Thufir the chance to ask for anything in return for his years of service.
Commands that Thufir Hawat, a captive and old teacher, be set free despite the tense situation.
Observes the Emperor's nervousness and the concealed knife, showing awareness of hidden threats.
Offers Thufir the chance to ask for anything in return for his years of service, demonstrating confidence and strategic generosity.
Offers his life to Thufir, showing trust and acceptance of fate.
Commands guards to honor Thufir after his death, showing respect and sincerity.
Smiles while threatening the Guildsmen, indicating a confident but potentially intimidating demeanor.
Calmly offers his life to Thufir, showing control and confidence in a tense moment.
Commands guards to honor Thufir after his death, demonstrating respect and leadership.
Boldly orders the Guild Heighliners to turn back, confronting powerful forces with authority.
Uses psychological tactics by speaking directly to hidden parties in the Heighliner control rooms, showing strategic thinking.
Smiles confidently in a high-stakes situation, indicating self-assurance and composure.
Confronts the Reverend Mother and asserts his independence from Bene Gesserit control, using The Voice to silence her.
Warns the Guild Navigator of his power to destroy the spice, demonstrating confidence and threat.
Challenges the Emperor and calls out a Harkonnen to stand forth, showing boldness but also aggression.
Uses his prescient and psychological powers confidently to intimidate the Guild Navigator and the Bene Gesserit, demonstrating control and awareness of his unique abilities.
Commands silence with The Voice, physically overpowering the Reverend Mother, showing mastery of Bene Gesserit techniques and confident leadership.
Challenges the Bene Gesserit’s breeding program and asserts his independence from their control, indicating strong self-awareness and strategic thinking.
Calls out the presence of a Harkonnen among the Emperor’s retinue, demonstrating insight and willingness to confront enemies openly.
Allows Feyd to take the Emperor's blade and face him honorably in combat.
Smiles during the fight, showing composure and a non-hostile demeanor despite the deadly duel.
Does not retaliate with excessive aggression or cruelty during the fight, maintaining a controlled and measured approach.
Engages in a deadly duel with Feyd, showing no mercy or friendliness toward an enemy.
Kills Feyd swiftly and decisively in combat, showing no mercy.
Promises Chani that Princess Irulan will have no claim to him or his children, affirming his love and loyalty to Chani.
Threatens the Emperor with exile or death, showing ruthless political resolve.
Speaks of a future with flowing water and green oases on Arrakis, showing hope and care for his people’s well-being.
Quotes the Fremen saying 'God created Arrakis to train the faithful,' acknowledging their beliefs and culture.
Issues a powerful wind and lightning to bring rain to Arrakis, providing relief and blessing to the Fremen.
